channel.title: Marijuana Laws
channel.description:
Jamestown 1619, first Marijuana law REQUIRED you to grow Cannabis Sativa. You could use hemp as payment in taxes, and it was used as a currency for around 200 years. The draft of and the original Deceleration Of Independence was written on hemp paper. In 1797 Gorge Washington's Primary crop at Mount Vernon was cannabis. Henry Fords first Model T car ran on Ethanol Hemp Oil. 1891 Queen Victoria was prescribed Marijuana for menstrual cramps. 1937 Federal Law bans Cannabis. 1942 US uses Marijuana as a "Truth Serum." 1965 1 Million Americans have smoked Marijuana. 1972 24 Million Americans have smoked Marijuana. 2003 First Country to make Medicinal Marijuana legal is Canada. 2008 The U.N. reports that 172 country's or territory's grow Marijuana.
[img]http://www.hort.purdue.edu/newcrop/ncnu02/images/hemp01.gif[/img]
http://www.drugpolicy.org/marijuana/factsmyths/
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9KLy150NR_U
I support legalization obviously. What is your opinion, and give rational reasons only please.

item.title: Marijuana Laws
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

theUnforgiven:

Marajuana is harmless, I agree, but it leads to stronger drugs like crack cocaine, heroin, acid that actually can harm you.

No…you lead yourself into that crap by hanging around the wrong people.

Marijuana usage of fine, just the selling of it and market of it is bad. You should be able to grow your own, and use your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana Laws
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

I didnt support it at first because I thought little kids would be able to get thier hand on this shit way easier. But now I do support it. Me and my Dad always talk about recent shit on the news at dinner and such, and this was the discussion one night. We argued about how it would be bad or good to be legalized, but now he brought up a good point. He said that if it were to be legalized, It would be easier to police and enforce the law on. He also brought up that (keeping marijuana illegal is expensive ). So I DO support it.

(note: I just cut alot of the story, so if it doesn’t make sense, oh well)

Read full topic

item.title: Marijuana Laws
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You forgot all about prop 19 and how it will probably legalise weed in California after the November 2nd ballots have been counted and verified.
Although everyone wants it legalised in the entire US, it just will never happen because of the number of health idiots, government idiots, safety idiots etc etc.

Same story in the UK, it just will never happen. The government keep changing the class of the drug (which if you don’t know classifies the severity of punishment for dealing/possession) from B to C, C to be B, and now back to B which makes no difference at all which shows they just can’t make up their mind up.

Read full topic
